text: hi guys it's Elise from a cupcake
addiction and on today's episode I'm
going to be showing you how to make
these sweet little fondant owl cupcake
toppers owls are such a popular theme
for so many different birthdays and
party occasions I've also made our cake
pops over on my channel so make sure you
check those out of your owl crazy but
let's get started with these gorgeous
little toppers for things that you'll
need for today's tutorial I've got some
plain tap water I'm using a couple of
circle cutters so I've got a larger just
a plain circle cutter and then I've got
a smaller Scala circle cutter I'm using
a small piping tip here but if you don't
have a piping tip in about this size you
can also look at using something like
just a pen lid or something it's going
to give you just a really nice small
circle I've got a paintbrush a knife and
a bit of wax paper some cornflour and a
shaker I'm opting for fondant today but
as I said you can also use modeling
chocolate here so I've got mine in
purple pink and orange I'm using a
fondant rolling pin and I've also got a
couple of Wilton candy eyes so let's get
started so the first thing that we want
to do is just pretend a little bit of
cornflour and we're just going to roll
out that pink fondant or modeling
chocolate and you don't wanna roll this
too thin with these toppers I love them
because they can be made in advance but
if you want them to stand up on a
cupcake a little bit like I have and not
lay completely flat on the top you do
actually want to make these about 6 to
12 hours in advance just so they've got
a bit of time to dry I'm going for about
that thickness for my fondant because I
want them to have enough support and
stability to hold their own weight so
you want to take your circle cutter now
and we're just gonna cut just a straight
edge circle and then out of your
straight edge circle you want to cut
just a little bit of a football-sized
nick out of the top because our bodies
aren't completely round I'm just gonna
use my fingers here just to kind of push
in the sides a little bit and that's
gonna keep that nice round bottom and
top but it's sort of flattening off the
sides a little bit and then you want to
grab it and just use your fingers just
to pull up those ears and just define
them a little bit and I'm also using my
thumb here to sort of push down that
little circle to make it a little bit
deeper
there's your little owl body shape so
now you want to add a little bit of kind
of like his chest feathers and we're
gonna use the piping tip or your pen lid
for that I found it easiest just to do
sort of two on the bottom row two or
three and I'm just using just the very
very bottom half of my piping tip so I'm
not putting the whole circle I'm just
putting a little half circle so three on
the bottom and then overlapping so that
you're putting another one in between
the join four in the next row and you
don't need to come all the way up your
ours body about halfway to a third of
the way is fine rolling out your purple
fondant now and you can make this a
little bit thinner this is going to be
for the wings and then taking that
circle cutter again just cut yourself
out a circle and then we're going to cut
another two of those little football
shapes for the wings so really these
owls are just made up of just some
really really basic shapes try to get
them all roughly the same size beautiful
now to give those wings a little bit of
texture I just use just a knife and just
kind of put some little lines in the
center of them and this is really just
so they've got a little bit of texture
and they don't look so flat and then a
little bit of water to attach those
wings on you just want to put your water
just sort of on one side of the wing not
on the whole thing because the whole
thing's not gonna be stuck only one side
of it is and then you want to bring it
with your wings you want to start them
just below where I guess the dip of your
head is and make sure they're about 3/4
of the way
over the owl with just the very edge
hanging off that's gonna stop them from
drooping beautiful now a little bit more
water and you can add on your little
fondant eyes or your little Wilton eyes
so just a bit of water on the back and
water always just acts like your glue
when you're working with fondant or
modeling chocolate just below the line
of the top of the wings there then you
want to roll out just a little bit of
your orange fondant and roll this quite
thin this is gonna be for a little feet
if you have access to little orange love
heart sprinkles but you can get in packs
of multicolored you can also use that
here and then you wouldn't need the
extra orange fondant and a little
serrated cutter so I'm just gonna cut a
little serrated circle a little
scalloped circle and then I'm gonna cut
almost a little love heart shape out of
it so just sort of coming down on two
lines and taking two of those little
scalloped edges and again over this side
so a little bit of water on the back and
I'm going to stick them down right at
the bottom of Mother
all there and then take this other
little kind of scrap and just roll it
into a ball before fashioning it into a
bit of a kind of a carrot shape or a
cone shape just check the size a little
bit more off the end you don't want this
nose to be too big you don't want to
speak to be too big so you need it to be
in proportion a little bit of water I'm
gonna put the water straight down onto
my top up down goes his little big right
in between his eyes so there you've got
your finished gorgeous and really simple
little owl cupcake toppers these are
perfect opping cupcakes but let your
imagination run wild you could also use
them on cakes you could use them for
cookies they have so many different uses
you can make them up to a week in
advance store them in an airtight
container if you haven't already
subscribed to my channel my cupcake
addiction and make sure you head on over
and hit the subscribe button for 3 times
weekly uploads and as always thanks very
much for watching my cupcake addiction
